From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: hunger

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German hunger, from Old High German hungar, from Proto-West Germanic *hungr, from Proto-Germanic *hungruz.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈhʊŋɐ/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: Hun‧ger

Noun

[edit]

Hunger m (strong, genitive Hungers, no plural)

  1. hunger

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Hunger [sg-only, masculine, strong]
singular
indef. def. noun
nominative ein der Hunger
genitive eines des Hungers
dative einem dem Hunger
accusative einen den Hunger

Derived terms

[edit]
  • hungrig
  • Hungertuch, Hungersnot, Hungerwinter, Hungerhaken, Hungerturm
  • Bärenhunger, Löwenhunger, Mordshunger
  • Hungerbrunnen, Hungerquelle

See also

[edit]
  • Schmacht

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Hunger” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache
  • “Hunger” in Duden online
  • “Hunger” in Deutsches Wörterbuch von Jacob und Wilhelm Grimm, 16 vols., Leipzig 1854–1961.
  • Friedrich Kluge (1883), “Hunger”, in John Francis Davis, transl., Etymological Dictionary of the German Language, published 1891
  • Hunger on the German Wikipedia.Wikipedia de

Hunsrik

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • hunger (Wiesemann spelling)

Etymology

[edit]

    Inherited from Middle High German hunger, from Old High German hungar, from Proto-West Germanic *hungr, from Proto-Germanic *hungruz, from Proto-Indo-European *kenk-.[1]

    Pronunciation

    [edit]
    • IPA(key): /ˈhuŋa/
    • Rhymes: -uŋa
    • Syllabification: Hun‧ger

    Noun

    [edit]

    Hunger m

    1. (uncountable) hunger (need for food)
      Ich hon Hunger ― I'm hungry (literally, “I have hunger”)

    Derived terms

    [edit]
    • hungre
    • hungrich

    References

    [edit]
    1. ^ Boll, Piter Kehoma (2021), “Hunger”, in Dicionário Hunsriqueano Riograndense–Português, 3rd edition (overall work in Portuguese), Ivoti: Riograndenser Hunsrickisch, page 79, column 2

    Low German

    [edit]

    Etymology

    [edit]

    From Middle Low German hunger, from Old Saxon hungar, from Proto-West Germanic *hungr, from Proto-Germanic *hungruz. Compare High German Hunger, Dutch honger, English hunger, Swedish hunger.

    Pronunciation

    [edit]
    • IPA(key): /ˈhʊŋːə(r)/

    Noun

    [edit]

    Hunger m (uncountable)

    1. hunger

    Derived terms

    [edit]
    • Hungersnoot
    • hungerig / hungrig

    North Frisian

    [edit]

    Alternative forms

    [edit]
    • honger (Föhr-Amrum)
    • hunger (Mooring)

    Etymology

    [edit]

    from Old Frisian hunger, from Proto-West Germanic *hungr, from Proto-Germanic *hungruz.

    Pronunciation

    [edit]
    • (Sylt) IPA(key): [ˈhʊŋɐ]

    Noun

    [edit]

    Hunger m

    1. (Sylt) hunger
